朼字的基本解释

朼
bǐ
古代祭祀时用的大木勺，用来挑起鼎中的牲体放在俎上：“乃朼载，载两髀于两端。”

朼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bǐ］
［《廣韻》卑履切，上旨，幫。］
大木匙。古祭祀用以挑起鼎中的牲置於俎上，或用以盛出甑甗中的饭食。

朼字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　朼； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页510第15
【唐韻】?履切【集韻】【韻會】補履切，?音比。匕也。本作匕，或作枇。【禮·雜記註】喪祭用桑，吉祭用棘，所以出牲體而載之俎者。【儀禮·士喪禮】乃朼載。【註】朼以出牲體，載而受於俎也。　又【正韻】補委切，音彼。義同。

朼字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
朼字的起名意思

暂无。

朼
Basic explanation of words
朼
bǐ
The large wooden spoon used in ancient sacrifices was used to provoke the body of the animal in the cauldron and put it on top of it: "Naizha, carry two scorpions on both ends."
朼
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bǐ］
["Guangyun" is humble, impeccable, help. ]
Big wooden spoon. The ancient sacrificial rituals were used to provoke the animals in the cauldron and put them on top, or to hold out the food in the retort.
朼
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　朼; Kangxi Strokes: 6; Page Number: Page 510 No. 15
[Tang Yun]? Lv cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme will] make up Lv cut, sound ratio. Dagger too. This is a dagger, or a slap. 【Ritual·Miscellaneous Notes】Sang is used for funeral sacrifices, and thorns are used for lucky sacrifices, so they are carried out of the animal body. [Rituals·Funerals] are nobles. [Note] To produce the animal body, it is carried and received by the Chu also.　[Zheng Yun] Supplementary committee cut, sound the other. The same meaning.
